question.qText: A major difference between Jacob Burckhardt and Peter Burke regarding their scholarship on the Renaissance is that

aBtn.aText: Burckhardt’s views are built on solid historical research.
Burckhardt was perhaps the first historian to recognize the Renaissance as a unique era.
Burke is unduly influenced by the writers of the Middle Ages.
Burke sees the Middle Ages as having the only real renaissances during Charlemagne’s era and the twelfth century.
Burke is an English historian while Burckhardt is Swiss.
